results.title: Kimono
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Iwanami Production
results.brief_description: This is the modern story of how, when and why the kimono is produced and worn - including wide variety designs, materials, and pattern basically remains the same for infants through to elderly.

results.title: Kimberley: Wandjina country (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Belinda Wright and Stanley Breeden are naturalists and photographers who work with the National Geographic Society. As they become fascinated with the “Wandjina” rock paintings, the viewer also gains some insight into the deep, spiritual relationship the Aboriginal people have with the land.

results.title: Kimberley: Wandjina country
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Part three of a series of six documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia. Belinda Wright and Stanley Breeden are naturalists and photographers who work for the National Geographic Society. As they become fascinated with the “Wandjina” rock paintings, the viewer also gains some insight into the deep, spiritual relationship the Aboriginal people have with the land. A Teacher’s guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Kimberley: land of the Wandjina
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit, Jeremy Hogarth and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Narrated by Leo McKern, this documentary, produced by the award-winning ABC TV Natural History Unit, explores the land and life of the spectacular Kimberley region of North West Australia. Aboriginal people believe that the Wandjina, the rain spirits, created the landscape. From the vast coastal mudflats to the tidal rivers and inland waterways, this beautifully photographed film explores in detail one of the least known regions of Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit, Jeremy Hogarth and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Kimberley Cops. Ep. 4: Taken by the tide
results.creator_credit: Paul Roy, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Iguana Films (AU)
results.brief_description: Final episode of a 4-part series which follows events over a year in the lives of several police officers as they keep law and order in the remote Kimberley area of Western Australia. In this episode, the Hall’s Creek Fishing Competition or the “Barra Bash” is taking place, creating quite an amount of organisational work for the Kimberley cops. One boat requires assistance when it breaks down in the Gulf, and another requires a marine search and rescue when it is reported overdue and missing late in the evening. Also shown is the community spirit which exists in the small isolated township of Wyndham, the network and support amongst the police wives, and the gnerally good relations which exist between the police and the Aboriginal community. Narrated by Peter Turnbull.

results.title: Kimberley Cops. Ep. 3: Gone from Diggers
results.creator_credit: Paul Roy, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Iguana Films (AU)
results.brief_description: Episode three of a 4-part documentary series which follows events over a year in the lives of several police officers as they keep law and order in the remote Kimberley area of Western Australia. In this episode it is the end of the wet season and tourists are flocking into Wyndham. For the Kimberley cops life just gets busier and busier. First they have to release a crocodile that has been caught in a trap. Crocodiles are a protected species but are becoming a threat to the tourist industry as their numbers increase. Then the police are called in to investigate the cause of a crash of a cattle truck which has come off the road and rolled over 150 kilometers west of Wyndham. And finally two tourists out on a walk have gone missing from Digger’s Rest Cattle Station requiring a co-ordinated search party to find them. Narrated by Peter Turnbull.

results.title: Kimberley Cops. Ep. 1: Follow the rock
results.creator_credit: Paul Roy, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Iguana Films (AU)
results.brief_description: ‘Kimberly cops’ is a 4-part documentary about policemen working in the isolated areas of Western Australia. Wyndham is a remote town 3200 kms from Perth - the population of 800 is largely Aboriginal. Policemen and their families move from the city to this isolated town to work, forced to adapt to a very inhospitable environment. The 1600 sq. km beat covers bush, river and rugged coastline, complete with large saltwater crocodiles. The area is made up of cattle stations, aboriginal settlements and tourist resorts. The episode follows a team of policemen and local Aboriginal volunteers who search for a missing tourist. The trip involves camping and travelling in rugged conditions in which the men have to be self-sufficient. With heat and dehydration being the major concern, they track and find the man with a broken ankle, desperate for a cigarette. The informative and entertaining documentary will interest and inform viewers. Narrated by Peter Turnbull.

results.title: Kimberley Cops. Ep. 02: End of the road
results.creator_credit: Paul Roy, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Iguana Films (AU)
results.brief_description: This episode of “Kimberley Cops”, a documentary series that relates the hardships and hazards for police stationed in isolated parts of Australia, focuses on the experiences of Hills Creek police officers. The rain season has arrived and we follow them as they travel to areas which will soon become inaccessible by road. The program captures the efforts of police to rectify past relations with Aboriginals in the area, particularly children, in developing mutual trust and respect.

results.title: Kimba the white lion. Volume 7
results.brief_description: Contains three episodes from the classic television series (fans of the original series note that these are not the original voices) of Kimba, King of the Jungle, a bravehearted white lion cub. Kimbas adventures bring him across new friends and sometimes some very unfriendly visitors, which often lands him in a spot of bother. However he always bounces back with enthusiasm and life, willing to give anything a go. The episodes on this tape are: ‘The Cobweb caper’, ‘A Friend indeed’ and the ‘Bad baboon’.
